page.title: 13Keymer Brick Works Bur. Hill
page.content: This is marked on the Ordnance Survey Map as a brickworks but makes only tiles now. The clay is dug up from the pits which are next to the works and comes to the mill on a conveyor belt. Here the clay goes into a mixing pan where it is mixed with water. Next it goes into a machine that makes it into 'bats', which are bits of clay that are cut up into strips. These are put into a room to be dried. When they are nearly solid they are 'biddled', which means they are hit with pieces of wood to put them into their proper shape. Then the tiles are put into a small room with a fan that dries them completely. They are then put into a kiln which is where they are baked until they are solid. There has recently been debate about whether to make old clay pits into rubbish dumps or a golf course.
